Nerangs.ab: yaθā ahū vairiiō dō andar rāh ēd bē gōwišn ō ī pas barsom šawēd u-š tarsāgīhā bē ēstišn
"He has to recite two yaθā ahū vairiiō on the way. He goes past the barsom and has to stand respctfully."

ab.ab: NērangVVrS0.5 (Nērang ī āb) [mss. 4000 4010 4020 4025 4063], cf. WiD, Revāyat of Kāma Bohra (MU1, p. I. 577) and Revāyat of Kāmdin Šapur (var. b) (MU1, p. I. 584), on the Nērang ī Āb ud Padyāb ceremony:
"(Pahl.) yadāhuwēryō dō andar rāh ēd bē gōbišn ō ī pas barsom šawet u-š tarsagāhīh bē estišn ud sidīgar bār sāzišn gōmēz āb xūb bē nigerišn"
"He (the zōt) has to recite two yaϑā ahī vairiiō on his way. He has to go towards the barsom and place his feet on it reverentially."
Revāyat of Behdin Ǧāsā (MU1, p. I. 592-93), cf. Revāyat of Kāmdin Šapur (var. a) (MU1, pp. I. 580-81), on the Nērang ī Āb ud Padyāb ceremony:

"(Pers.) cenānke dar yašt sāḫtan ẏaϑā ahū vairiiō. do ẏasnəmcā. tā sar ahurahe mazdā̊ raē. (Pahl.) OD pas dur āmadan (AvPersTr.) ašim vohu (Pers.) ānkas ke yašt ḫᵛāhand kardan (AvPersTr) is̱ā ahu vairiyo andar rāh goftan va be š́iiaoϑə̄naną̇m. bālāy-e (†pāy-ī) rāst andar zudgāh nahādan bar yazešn gāh nešastan va beyazdān va amšāsfandān setāyeš bordan ve beyāri miṭalbidan va ānkas ke rās̱vi ast zud dast ḫošk kardan va soruš darun nahādan va panǧ (AvPersTr.) is̱ā ahu vairiyo ḫᵛāndan va esm va buy se tā nahādan dast ḫošk kardan ānkas ke yazešn ḫᵛāhad kardan dast beāb pādyāvi šostan hamā sāǧešn bekardan va rās̱vi moḥkam nešastan dast be ātas bordan hamā ǧā ke vāǧ ke piš neveštam va begoftan beistādan pas negaridan pas vāǧ-e digar begoftan"

"The person who has prepared de ritual (performed the Paragna), (at the) two yaϑā ahū vairiiō (should recite) yasnəmcā until the endo of ahurahe mazdā̊ raē. until (the end). Afterwards he should go away (reciting) aṣ̌əm vohū. The one who wants to perform the ceremony has to recite two yaϑā ahū vairiiō on his way and at š́iiaōϑənanąm put his right foot on the zōtgāh and sit reverentially. He should praise the Yazdan and the Aməṣ̌a Spəṇta and call them to his assistance. That person who is the rāspīg should soon make his hands dry, put the Srōš Drōn and utter five yaϑā ahū vairiiō and arrange thre esm and boy and make his hands dry. The person who is to perform the Yasna should wash his hands with the padyāb, and look at all the apparatus. The rāspīg should sit straight, carry his hands to the fire. At all places, the words I indicate below should be uttered and they should stay and look and then recite the remaining words."

Commentary.ab: For a description of the actions of the rāspīg, see Y0.5.
